identification.cap: Hemispherical to convex flattening, 2.0-5.9 inches, sticky moist shiny areolate dry, bright red fading whitish bloom young, margin inrolled curving up.
identification.pores: Deep red to paler, 2-3 per mm circular, tubes 0.35-0.59 inches mustard yellow blue bruise, amber droplets exude young.
identification.stem: 1.6-4.7 inches long, 0.4-1.0 inch thick, equal or ventricose, deep red yellowish base, coarse net-like reticulation, yellowish-white to light yellow mycelium.
identification.flesh: Up to 1.0 inch thick, pale yellow to lemon red in stem base, stains blue variably, sweet citrusy mildly acidic taste/smell.
identification.microscopic: Spores 13-22 × 4-5 µm spindle-shaped smooth yellow in KOH; basidia 26-35 × 10.5-11.5 µm four-spored; cystidia 30-53 × 7.5-14 µm hyaline spindle to bottle-shaped; pileipellis ixocutis gelatinized 3-6 µm yellow subcutis 5-13 µm.

habitat: Mycorrhizal hardwoods especially oaks, solitary scattered gregarious, sandy thin soils under oaks grassy lawns Florida, eastern US Maine to Georgia Midwest Michigan Tennessee Southwest Arizona Mexico Costa Rica, summer to early autumn June-September.
